article.headline: Siena 66, St. Peter's 58
article.story: JERSEY CITY, N.J. -- Ryan Rossiter scored 21 points and grabbed nine rebounds to lead Siena to a 66-58 victory over Saint Peter's on Thursday night, extending the longest winning streak in Division I to 12 games. Siena (18-4, 11-0 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) has not lost since dropping an 82-65 decision to Northern Iowa on Dec. 12. The Saints went 1-for-10 from beyond the arc, but Kyle Griffin hit their only 3-pointer for a 54-48 lead with 8:44 left in the game. Saint Peter's (12-9, 7-4), which had a five-game winning streak snapped, cut the lead to 58-56. But Alex Franklin scored on a layup for a four-point lead with 36 seconds to play. Clarence Jackson added 15 points, Ronald Moore had 10 and nine assists, and Franklin had 10 rebounds. Wesley Jenkins led Saint Peter's with 13 points. Nick Leon added 12 and Ryan Bacon finished with 11 points and 15 rebounds.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
